channel.title: Ancient staff sets Ancient spells please
channel.description:
When I have a ancient staff I can only use normal spells when I try and set. Is there a way to SET ancients spell when wielding a ancient staff? Thanks.
Sorry for bumping, its just annoying me.[br][size=1]Posted on: December 30, 2006, 02:49:23 PM[/size][hr]I could also add you on msn, post your address.

where the hell do you put this blimmin code jonathan m omg tell us where to put it i guessing it client.java but what do i search up and then replace or put code under plz people tell me so then i happy by the way i got a funny feeling a couple of people did jump off bridge with anvil coz not many replying

item.title: Ancient staff sets Ancient spells please
item.dc:creator: @Jonathan_M Jonathan M
item.description:
@Jonathan_M wrote:

I don’t know if there is a way to make it so you can auto maticle cast it, but heres a code to make ancient staff turn your magic book into ancients!

search for if (targetSlot == playerWeapon && wearID >= 0) and under the playerSER = 0x680;
}
add
if (wearID == 4675) {
ancients = 1;
setSidebarInterface(6, 12855);
updateRequired = true;
}
OMG IT WORKS??

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Jonathan_M Jonathan M
item.description:
@Jonathan_M wrote:

On topic, no clue

"
You are almost the most retarded person ever to post on this forum.

Java is a programming language. You make programs with it.
JavaScript is a client side scripting language for web browsers. You make web pages with it.

If anyone still doesn’t understand the difference after I have just explained it, then they should jump off a bridge while carrying an anvil.
"
YAY! Another person who understands java------------------->SCRIPT<-------------------

blakeman8192: read a book you no nothing (about javascript).

"
You guys are frikkin idiots…

ill show yoou the difference between Java and JavaScript

Java:Basic compared to JavaScript
JavaScript:More complex yet not as easy to code as Java

You’re better off using Java…it’s for Java Experience lv: 1 - 10
JavaScript Experience lv: 9-10
"
What? More complex?? Only if you don’t know javascript, javascript is easy…its java that gets me weirded out
